data.title: Rev. Dr. Don Davis
data.meta_description: Hopelessness is prison leads to higher recidivism rates.  We encourage you to read more about it to better understand how you can help.
data.text:
Rev. Dr. Don Davis is a well known and respected leader in the Christian community. This video was filmed when David Phillips, the founder of Brand 316 was able to introduce Brand 316 to over 50 Wichita area pastors. Davidâ€™s goal was to introduce the program to the pastors and to plant the seeds so that they fully understood that Brand 316 has created a solution for the formerly incarcerated through its intense and detailed reintegration training program. In this video, Dr. Davis shares his thoughts in reference to Brand 316 and the call to help those in need. We were thankful that Dr. Davis took the time to hear about Brand 316 as well as share his thoughts. We encourage you to listen to it in full and do more research on how you can support Brand 316, Inc and our goals of lowering recidivism through the personal, professional and spiritual development of the formerly incarcerated.

Learn More about Rev. Dr. Don Davis below:

Dr. Don Davis is the Sr. Vice President of World Impact and Executive Director, TUMI. TUMI is a subsidiary of World Impact that provides urban Christian leaders with quality biblical training at an affordable price and education that is relevant to urban ministry and mission. Dr. Don Davis, founder and director of The Urban Ministry Institute, has been involved in urban ministry and missions with World Impact since 1975. He has spent his entire ministry career seeking to raise up a new generation of qualified spiritual leaders, pastors, and church planters who can build up Christ's church in the most vulnerable and unreached urban communities in America and across the world. As of June 2020, TUMI currently supports 311 TUMI satellites in 20 countries (64 sites of which in prisons). He is a graduate of Wheaton College (B.A., Biblical Studies) and Wheaton Graduate School (M. A., Systematic Theology,) with summa cum laude honors in both degrees respectively. He earned his Ph.D. in Religion (2000, Theology and Ethics) from the University of Iowa School of Religion. A recipient of numerous teaching and academic awards, he has also authored a number of books, curricula, and study materials all to equip, empower, and release biblical leaders to serve the Church of Jesus among the poor and oppressed, and display Kingdom transformation where they live and minister.
